cyclone.name: HAROLD
cyclone.current_location: about 375 mi (600 km) ESE of Port Mansfield, Texas
cyclone.trajectory: moving quickly westward toward the south-Texas coast with inland passage across the Rio Grande Valley
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: south Texas coast near the mouth of the Rio Grande / Baffin Bay area

weather_observation.warning_coast: Mouth of Rio Grande to Port O'Connor, Texas
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Lower and middle Texas coast from the mouth of the Rio Grande northward through Matagorda Bay
weather_observation.wind: Tropical storm-force winds (35–45 mph with higher gusts) possible Tuesday
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–3 ft inundation possible along the lower Texas coast, including near Brownsville
weather_observation.rainfall: 3–5 inches with isolated totals up to 7 inches, creating flash-flood potential
weather_observation.other_hazards: Isolated tornadoes and dangerous rip currents
